attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to fly the Union Flag on all public buildings.
attributes.background: The UK appears to have a most disgraceful fear of displaying our national flag on public buildings, on the grounds of either some misplaced sense of danger under health & safety legislation or for fear of offending some minority group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is one of the only countries in the world where the flying of the national flag is actively discouraged by local councils and governmental bodies. This is a national & international disgrace.

The UK has decided that it no longer wishes to be politically associated with our European neighbours, rather to display our independence. Yet we are actively discouraged from showing our national flag as a symbol of that very independence.

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Change in Immigration rules due to the immigration solicitors negligence
attributes.background: Our application  for leave to remain was simply rejected because our Immigration solicitor showed negligence in our application, after spending 11 years in UK we are now on verge to be removed from UK, I request everyone to sign this petition and bring change in immigration rules
attributes.additional_details:
We want Secretary of State to consider Solicitor's negligence as an exceptional circumstances.

For Example Law includes below as exceptional circumstances currently :
o travel or postal delays. 
or beyond control situation for applicant.
For example:
o The Home Office has lost or delayed returning travel documents.
o The applicant is having problems replacing lost documents as a result of theft, fire or
flood. 

but Point requested to be included in Law is as below:
o Your previous solicitor's showed negligence in your case and you have evidance from legal ombudsman to prove solicitors negligence.

attributes.action: Make the Punishment fit the Crime
attributes.background: Today the Victim does Not get Justice in Many cases, Causing Death by say Dangerous Driving when they get their sentence Cut in Half and winds up around Two years per Life makes life Cheap, they should be Banned for say Ten years and Ten years per life taken, they will not learn by a slap on hand.
attributes.additional_details:
More sentences are stupid when handed out, Victims Must see Justice done for their Loss, many Stupid Boy Racers who should never be on the road for others Safety.

They also Must pass their Test again.

Also this Applies to All other Deaths by whatever means.

Let's Stop Silly Sentences being handed out from the Courts, bet they would not like it for one of their family Members.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of Economics at GCSE level.
attributes.background: Teaching Politics does not help voters make an informed decision on matters such as the EU Referendum, as it is largely an economical matter. It gives us little insight to the implications of our decisions. Economics gives children factual knowledge to allow them to form decisions on such matters.
attributes.additional_details:
The effect a decision will have on the economy is central to any debate or issue. To make an informed decision, people require knowledge (e.g how free markets work) and the effect their vote will have on the economy. Knowledge of Economics allows students to make educated and substantial choices.

By teaching Economics, this is providing students skills for adult life, a major issue with schools as they fail to teach students skills useful in adult life such as budgeting, taxes and employment.

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: Teach children in schools about voting and parliament - primary school onwards.
attributes.background: After the recent referendum and outcomes of general elections I feel there's a clear need for people to be taught about the process, as well as learning to cross reference and rattify information to ensure they're making a truly informed decision.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at £9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to £20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: Allow a further EU referendum in 2018
attributes.background: We need a further vote.

attributes.action: Install a shield in the Commons Chamber in memory of Jo Cox MP
attributes.background: Following the sickening murder of Jo Cox MP whilst serving her constituents, Parliament should move to install a shield -like the shield installed for Airey Neave- in the Commons Chamber.

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: Greater independent regulation and oversight throughout buying a new home
attributes.background: Stressful enough, the process of buying a new house is fraught with legal traps and hidden charges for the consumer, where developers have free-reign to act as they please. Just like the majority of other industries, we need a body to provide advice to consumers and help when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Buyers being forced to queue in the freezing cold overnight for the right to reserve a property should not happen in the 21st Century, and neither should waiting almost a year trapped, having legally exchanged contracts, to move in.

Thanks to schemes like help-to-buy it is getting easier for first time buyers to purchase, and new-build properties are the key. The NHBC is there to help when you've moved in, but we need an independent regulating body to help through the process of purchasing.

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the £40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: One copy of the British Bill of Rights for every household.
attributes.background: In anticipation of the UK government's desire to replace the Human Rights act with a British Bill of Rights, it seems vital that every citizen have available to them a hard copy version of the new document thus insuring they can know, with complete transparency, exactly what their rights are.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a long history of enshrining the rights of it's citizens in law, from the Magna Carta in 1215 onwards we actually have a proud history of attempting (if not always succeeding) to insure human rights are protected in law.

In the interests of empowering the people that they should know their rights, and thus aid the government in insuring the public trust it's promise to uphold human rights, giving (not selling) every household a copy of the new document is essential.

attributes.action: MPs should be paid the National Living Wage after regaining control of their pay
attributes.background: Many working people struggle financially on low wages. MPs are currently 'forced' to receive large salaries and pay increases by an independent body.  By reclaiming their right to set their own pay they could set it at the National Living Wage. This would encourage them to work for a fairer society.

attributes.action: Removal of discourteous remarks/misdiagnosis from medical records
attributes.background: Too many deaths or extended suffering caused by erroneous comments in medical records. There is also too much focus on psychology as a cop-out diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details:
When the patient is later found to have a serious physical illness, the error and misdiagnosis remains in the medical records, along with any discourteous remarks. 
The patient is not empowered and can't get the entry  removed, only blocked.

attributes.action: Can the UK have a memorial for the 763 plus Soldiers  killed  Northern Ireland
attributes.background: Ex- Soldier who served 4 tours in NI and lost 5 good friends over there. I have seen memorials for WW1 WW2, The Falklands war and today the unveiling of one for the first Gulf War. It is as if we are being ignored.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Include same sex relationships as grounds for divorce under adultery
attributes.background: It seems absurd that a same sex couple can get married but if one of them should stray with a same sex person outside of the marriage adultery cannot be cited as grounds for divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
The same can be said for a traditional marriage where either partner has a relationship outside with a person the same sex as themselves, this isn't recognised as adultery.

This law should be overhauled to state that having sexual relations outside of marriage with any person is adultery.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift everywhere
attributes.background: Argyll and Bute are cutting green bin waste collections by a third in Kintyre without providing a safe, secure or easily accesible alternative which has lead to feelings of insecurity, people buying bins out of their own pocket when they already pay council tax.
attributes.additional_details: Aim of this petiiton is to provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift in each area (I.e if an area was originally green bin only at 140l weekly and then becomes 2/3 weekly still at 140l the council must provide other recycling bins that add up to the same total of 140l a week) So a 2 weekly collection would be 2 bins at 140l (one recycling, one not) 3 weekly would be 3 140l or 1 140l and 1 280l.

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: Trident to be removed from Scotland and renewed in England
attributes.background: Trident is not welcome in Scotland and rejected by Scottish MPs, if English MPs vote for the renewal of WMD then it should be done in England and not Scotland where it is heavily opposed.

attributes.action: A General Election or another EU Referendum
attributes.background: Considering the very misleading campaign to leave the EU, the fallout we have witnessed since the now obviously flawed results and the fact that nobody in power seems to be acknowledging these issues, we the undersigned demand that the fixed term rules of Parliament be put aside and call an election
attributes.additional_details: If Parliament are not willing to allow a general election at this volatile and very confusing time, then at least pay attention to the facts surrounding the EU Referendum, that the results were largely due to flawed campaigns, lies and manipulations.  Many people, an estimated 7% according to one survey would vote differently 'now they know' the facts.  A referendum should not be actioned on results garnered through false information and scare tactics.  Election, or another referendum is needed.

attributes.action: Local Council Register all fitness professionals that can practice legitimately
attributes.background: Currently there is no regulation of non qualified fitness professionals from practising without qualifications and insurance. To maintain standards a register of all trading fitness/massage persons working/earning should be controlled by local councils. REPS and CIMSPA can only regulate upon members
attributes.additional_details: Poor quality and lack of knowledge isn't the way forward to providing good exercise prescription. This just simply isn't safe if you are charging the client or giving it for free. If you have no qualifications/experience you can mislead people into thinking you can training healthy people or people with diagnosed medical conditions or injuries or even have no insurance. We must raise the standard of what clients have as a fitness professional and impose some kind of penalty.

attributes.action:
Outlaw Investor-State Dispute Settlements
(Investors Suing the U.K. Government)
attributes.background: Investor-State Dispute Settlement clauses in trade deals provide a means for foreign investors to sue governments for policies which harm their profits. If successful, taxpayer money is used to pay damages to them. A government can thus be more beholden to corporations than the public they serve.
attributes.additional_details:
The TTIP trade agreement contains one such ISDS clause. The Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) and Trade In Services Agreement (TISA) have one also. 
Secretly negotiated, they ensure foreign corps are able to sue 2/3 of the world's governments and block trade with the emerging economies of China, Brazil, Russia, India and S. Africa. 
Examples:
Vattenfall vs Germany for phasing out nuclear energy ($3.7bn)
Veolia vs Egypt (introducing a minimum wage)
B.A.T. vs Australia (tobacco advertising laws)

attributes.action: Make non-payment of rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Landlords need protection from unscrupulous people who refuse to pay their rent knowing the law is in favour of the tenant. Not only will they  continue to live rent free sometimes for up to a year but they will often trash the property rendering it uninhabitable and then move doing the same again.
attributes.additional_details: Unscrupulous tenants deliberately fail to pay their rent knowing that the legal processes of eviction are long and tedious,They take advantage of this often causing serious damage to a property while the landlord is waiting for legal processes to take effect. These types often cause conflict with neighbours and no-one can take them to task over it. When they are eventually evicted they repeat the process elsewhere  without paying a penny towards their debt or being held accountable for damage.

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: Invoke The Treaty of Windsor to protect Portuguese in the UK and vice versa
attributes.background: In the spirit of mutual assistance contained within the “Anglo Portuguese Alliance” and with recent post Brexit extremist goading non UK citizens to leave I propose UK give special protection and rights to Portuguese within the UK  and the same protection be afforded to UK citizens in Portugal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of Windsor has been invoked by the UK on a numbers of occasions to protect the UK including two world wars & the Falklands campaign 
Treaty text of the extant alliance guaranteeing assistance refers: "the ally shall be bound to give aid and succour to the other, so far as he is able (without any deceit, fraud, or pretence) to the extent required by the danger to his ally’s realms, lands, domains, and subjects; and he shall be firmly bound by these present alliances to do this”

attributes.action: Article 50 must be invoked within12 mths following the result of the referendum.
attributes.background: David Cameron has not invoked article 50. In order to stop this or a future government from not respecting the result of the referendum and the wishes of the people of the UK, there must be a rule that Article 50 must be invoked within 12 months of the result of the referendum.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum for British expatriates.
attributes.background:
My family and I (all British Nationals) have lived and worked in France  for the last 25 years.  
The latest EU referendum will have severe repercussions on our future, and we should have the right to participate in the process.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently we can neither vote in UK General Elections nor French Parliamentary or Presidential Elections.  As EU citizens, we can vote in European elections and in French local elections. 
The decision on Britain's continued membership of the EU is of critical importance to us and will have far-reaching consequences for the future of all British nationals living and working in Europe and further afield.

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for peodophiles and child sex offenders
attributes.background: Make the future safer for kids.

attributes.action: The World Heritage City of Bath Should Remain within the EU and leave the UK
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU after 43 years. A 57.9% majority of Bath residents voted to remain. There was a turnout of 105,298 in Bath & NE Somerset, that's 77.13%. 60,878 of residents voted to remain. We are a World Heritage City. We want to remain and share that heritage with Europe.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Terms of a Bill of Rights before Assent to Leave the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum set citizen versus citizen. The EU guaranteed Fundamental Rights. Hillsborough & Stafford show it was left to Citizens to enforce the most basic of Rights - to Life & for Justice. Government & MP's knew but failed - Year after Year. We cannot allowed such rights to be ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU requires a further treaty before Parliament. It should NOT BE passed without the fundamental rights of each UK citizen GUARANTEED first.

Mr Gove's plan is for a BILL OF RIGHTS to abolish the Human Rights Act when most citizens cannot enforce any current rights. 

RIGHTS TO BE TAKEN AWAY should be subject to REFERENDUM before the Act of Leaving. Limit their power to hurt YOU, your Family, & Fellow Citizens. SOVEREIGNTY means the MP is the servant and not the Master

Remind them.

attributes.action: End Taxpayer Bail-outs of Banks by removing limitation of shareholder liability.
attributes.background: Between 2007 and 2010 the British Taxpayer bailed out the banks and bankers with cash and guarantees totalling £1,162 BILLION, equivalent to almost 3 times the total NHS budget for the same 4-year period! (Source: NAO; https://www.nao.org.uk/highlights/taxpayer-support-for-uk-banks-faqs/)
attributes.additional_details: The remedy is to ensure that shareholders are on the hook for all the banks' liabilities without a taxpayer safety net. They will then hold bank directors and management to account and monitor risk to prevent recurrences of such disasters. To achieve this, Parliament should remove shareholders' limited liability in banks (and any other business deemed too big to fail), so that shareholders, not taxpayers, are liable for all the banks' liabilities. There can be no reasonable objection to this.

attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.
